laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal sinus rhythm; ST-segment elevations of 1 to 2 mm in leads V2 to V4, with a biphasic T wave in V3; and deep, symmetric T-wave inversions in leads V4 to V6.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent ST-segment elevation and T-wave inversions on repeat electrocardiogram.
The cardiac biomarker levels decreased from the peak values noted at admission.

findings.ventricular_systolic_function: Mild ventricular systolic dysfunction with akinesis of the apex, mid anterior wall, mid anteroseptum, mid septum, and mid posterior wall.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A repeat echocardiogram showed left ventricular hypertrophy with normal left ventricular function, estimated ejection fraction of 75%, and resolution of the mitral regurgitation.
